Navigate to other release versions of Doxee Platform Template Designer

[6.6](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/template-designer-6-6)

[6.7](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/template-designer-6-7)

Being easily reusable document components *Template Parts *are one of the most powerful concepts of *Doxee Template Designer*.

One reusable component that is complete by itself is called *Template Part*. It can be used by referring to it. Technical speaking *Template Parts *are *xsl:template *elements, which suggest the possible use of data driven selection of *Template Parts *using the *Apply Templates *element.

The system allows creating either a local *Template Part *or external *Template Parts *contained by so called *Template Part Package*. Local *Template Parts *can be (re)used within the template that contains them. External *Template Parts *are made to be used within any number of templates. It is possible to gather as many *Template Parts *within a *Template Part Package *as needed. In order to use a package in a *Template *it is necessary to simply import it in the *External Resources *node in the *Outline view*.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

*Figure 177. Referenced Template Part Packages*

In order to use the *Template Part *a *Template Part Reference *element needs to be placed in the template.

*Template Parts *can be single *inline *elements (e.g. holding single characters or words) or complex *block-level *structures (i.e. bigger parts of a template â€“ e.g. the content of a header or footer). In order to avoid unnecessary errors it is important to insert *Template Part References *at the correct content level. This means that the insertion of a *Template Part Reference *to an *inline Template Part *on a *block *level causes an error and thus a non- renderable document. This error can also occur in the opposite direction. The window *Problems *provides information on these errors (See chapter ![](data:image/png;base64,) [Problems](/doxee-platform/docs/6-6-template-designer-user-guide-views-1#problems).

This installation contains examples of the correct use of *Template Parts*, e.g. *&lt;Infinica Template Designer Directory&gt;/Examples/INFINICA Mobile/Invoice/en*.
